Mr. William G. Harley
~ 2 ~
It was because of these views that I told you in Washington
that I did not greatly care what you, Hull and Miles decided
to do. Because, if you people will not oppose an organization
which desperately wishes to destroy your radio network, your
organizational base of membership and your prestige with
industry and foundations (and which has never hidden these
aims and has already attained some of them) then I cannot
help you. If Hull wants to preach "Exodus‚Äù again and follow
through this time you can count on me also. But if you are
determined to (1) surrender your organizational base - the
stations, (2) surrender your radio network - or let it become
impotent and (3) go bankrupt - then I must decline to fight
for the NAEB alone.
Sincerely.
John C. Schwarzwalder
General Manager
cc: Mr. Richard Hull
Mr. Jim Miles
Mr. Ray Hurlbert
Mr. Leonard Marks
